page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY OF MARSKE AREA
page.content: Marske from Anglo Saxon 'merse' - marsh. Not mentioned in Domesday Book. History bound up with former landlords-Huttons. Sale of estate to tenants in 1960 caused changes. Sale of Halls & cottages brought in new blood. Now a static farming population; in one case to fifth generation. School closed in 1961. Lime kilns, quarries & leadworking disused. Not involved with national events since 1745. Place names associated with past history-Nun Cote Nook &Marrick Priory; Davids House was home of David Place who died in 1760; Blacks Hill-near former abode of black servant of landlord in 18 century. Old fields names servive-Hangings, Tile sheds & Gallop End-exercise ground of racehorses, including Marske, sire of world famous sire Eclipse,18th century
